comments: It violates two fundamental rules for safety.  It (apparently) has no 6 amp circuit breaker.  And it has some tiny joule protector parts that can cause a fire and can sometimes compromise (bypass) what is superior protection inside electronics.

This is how it looks from the back.

https://preview.redd.it/yzhmdlcuznxa1.jpeg?width=3024&format=pjpg&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=f51bed3d126d7a44f925291c4e44852e6fb36717

But is it good for charging mobile or should I just avoid  it? Thanks ðŸ˜Š

See that tiny joule, 4 rupee part?  Its tiniest joules are why fires are created. Part also must connect through a less than 1 amp thermal fuse.  To also avert fires.  Two reasons why it is unsafe.

 And no 6 amp circuit breaker. Another threat.  Don't leave it unsupervised.
Thank you very much bro. ðŸ˜Š
